p: We identified alkaloids, norlignan, phenolics, steroids, and terpenoids in C. orchioides and C. latifolia ( Table S1). The compound identified from the triterpenoid (cycloartane) class in the Curculigo sample was curculigosaponin G, H, and I. Curculigosaponin G ( m/z 783.488, ion mode [M + H] +) is fragmented into m/z 621.867 [M + H-C 6H 12O 5] +, which indicates the release of C 6H 12O 5 molecules followed by m/z 459.726 [M + H-C 6H 12O 5] + due to the release of C 6H 12O 5 ( Figure S3A). Curculigosaponin H ( m/z 915.529, ion mode [M + H] +) is fragmented into m/z 751.350 [M + H-C 6H 12O 5] + and indicates the loss of C 6H 12O 5 molecules followed by m/z 589.137 [M + H-C 6H 12O 5] + and 458.650 [M + H-C 5H 10O 4] +, which indicates the release of C 6H 12O 5 and C 5H 10O 4 molecules ( Figure S3B). Curculigosaponin I with m/z 945.150 in ion mode [M + H] + fragmented into m/z 783.009, 621.867, and 458.726, which indicates the release of three C 6H 12O 5 molecules ( Figure S3C). The occurrence of fragmentations at m/z 459.726, 458.650, and 458.726 indicates the basic framework of triterpenoid saponins.
